parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.
From chora; to be in space, i.e. to pass, enter, or to hold, admit.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
